Uses of Interface
javaslang.control.Try

  • Packages that use Try 
    Package Description
    javaslang.control
    Control structures like Match, the disjoint union type Either, the optional value type Option and Try for exception handling.

    • Uses of Try in javaslang.control

      Classes in javaslang.control that implement Try 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Failure<T>
      A failed Try.
      class  Success<T>
      A succeeded Try.
      Methods in javaslang.control that return Try 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Try<Void> Try.andThen(Try.CheckedRunnable runnable)
      Runs the given runnable if this is a Success, otherwise returns this Failure.
      Try<Throwable> Try.failed()
      Returns Success(throwable) if this is a Failure(throwable), otherwise a Failure(new UnsupportedOperationException("Success.failed()")) if this is a Success.
      Try<T> Success.filter(Try.CheckedPredicate<? super T> predicate) 
      Try<T> Try.filter(Try.CheckedPredicate<? super T> predicate)
      Returns this if this is a Failure or this is a Success and the value satisfies the predicate.
      <U> Try<U> Success.flatMap(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends Kind<Try<?>,U>> mapper) 
      <U> Try<U> Try.flatMap(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends Kind<Try<?>,U>> mapper)
      FlatMaps the value of a Success or returns a Failure.
      default <U> Try<U> Try.flatten(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends Kind<Try<?>,U>> f)
      Flattens a nested, monadic structure using a function.
      <U> Try<U> Success.map(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends U> mapper) 
      <U> Try<U> Try.map(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends U> mapper)
      Maps the value of a Success or returns a Failure.
      static <T> Try<T> Try.of(Try.CheckedSupplier<T> supplier)
      Creates a Try of a CheckedSupplier.
      Try<T> Try.onFailure(Try.CheckedConsumer<Throwable> f)
      Consumes the throwable if this is a Failure, otherwise returns this Success.
      Try<T> Success.peek(Try.CheckedConsumer<? super T> action) 
      Try<T> Try.peek(Try.CheckedConsumer<? super T> action)
      Applies the action to the value of a Success or does nothing in the case of a Failure.
      Try<T> Failure.recover(Try.CheckedFunction<Throwable,? extends T> f) 
      Try<T> Try.recover(Try.CheckedFunction<Throwable,? extends T> f)
      Returns this, if this is a Success, otherwise tries to recover the exception of the failure with f, i.e.
      Try<T> Failure.recoverWith(Try.CheckedFunction<Throwable,Try<T>> f) 
      Try<T> Try.recoverWith(Try.CheckedFunction<Throwable,Try<T>> f)
      Returns this, if this is a Success, otherwise tries to recover the exception of the failure with f, i.e.
      static Try<Void> Try.run(Try.CheckedRunnable runnable)
      Creates a Try of a CheckedRunnable.
